campaign.story:
It's a Wonderful Kingdom has been especially designed to be an intense and strategic 2-player game. The game last 4 rounds, each round being divided into 3 phases:

 Split & Trap: collect cards and try to trap your opponent.
 Planification: choose the cards you want to build and the ones to recycle in order to develop faster.
 Production: produce resources in a sequential order.
 First, both players draw 7 cards from the Development Deck. The cards are divided into 4 categories:
 Structures (Farm, Outpost, ...)
 Specialists (Scientist, Great Army, ...)
 Monuments (Great Lighthouse, Botanical Gardens, ....)
 Discoveries (Moonbramble forest, Subterranean crystals...)
These cards are the means to develop your Duchy, enhance its production and earn victory points.
In addition to the 7 cards, you'll add a Calamity card to your hand. It's a strictly negative card that reduces your score at the end of the game.

Then, the Split & Trap phase begins. The active player chooses 2 cards from their hand and place them in the offering areas for their opponent.

Each player has 2 Trap tokens, allowing them to place some cards face down. It gives the opportunity to trick the opponent into taking a calamity. It can also be used to protect important cards the player would like to retrieve.
That’s the important guessing part of It's a Wonderful Kingdom. Will you outsmart the opponent and read into their actions so you don’t fall into any trap?
Once a player placed 2 cards from his hand on the table, the opponent chooses one of the two offering areas, and collect all the cards there, placing them in their Selection Area.
The face down cards must stay face down once collected. Choose wisely! When both players’ hands are empty, they move on to the Planning phase.

During this phase, players may recycle some of their collected cards to immediately gain the corresponding resources, and keep other cards to build them for victory points or to enhance the production of the Duchy.
Choosing which card to keep, and which card to recycle will be key to seize the throne!
Last, comes the Production phase. 
Unlike in other games, resources will be produced in a precise order in It's a Wonderful Kingdom:
Materials (grey)
Population (purple)
Gold (Yellow)
Exploration (blue)
If you anticipated this phase well during the Planning phase, you will construct cards in chain. With the right timing, some cards can produce during the very same phase in which they were constructed, hence speeding your development up!
It's a Wonderful Kingdom is a Modular game. Several modules are modifying the rules, the interaction, and even the difficulty of your games.

During setup, choose one of the available modules. There are 3 standard modules, and 1 additional module in the Legends box:
 Quest: complete tasks to earn rewards.
 Advisors: use unique and powerful abilities to change the course of the game
 Menaces: asymmetrical confrontation using the Menace cards to slow your opponent down.
 Conquest (Legends box only): conquer enemy territories to develop your production and earn additional abilities or bonuses.
If you want more details about the gameplay, please download the rulebook hereunder (beta version). 
Taxes will be charged to you by your country if you wish to have your rewards delivered outside of the US, Canada, the EU, the UK, China, Hong-Kong, Macao, Australia, Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam, India, Indonesia and New Zealand,   
La boite de jeu is a company founded in 2013. Since then, La boite de jeu created and successfully delivered 8 Kickstarter projects. 
Origames is a company founded in 2010. They have worked with la Boite de jeu as co-publisher for more than 6 games in the past 5 years. 

Crew:
 Author: Frédéric Guérard
 Illustrator: Anthony Wolff
 Concept of Legends Cover: Pauline Détraz
 Project Manager and Developper: Benoit Bannier & Guillaume Gille-Naves
 Artistic Director: Igor Polouchine
 Graphic execution: Benjamin Carayon
 Rules editing: Guillaume Gille-Naves & Benjamin Carayon
 3D visual: Benjamin Colomb
 Translators: Nathan Morse, Álex Garcigregor, Tomasz Konatkowski, Wabbit Translations.
 Community manager: Thibaut Chaize & Gregory Oliver
 Video trailer: Benjamin Carayon & Benjamin Colomb
Pictures are not definitive. Details and colors may vary.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are now very familiar with Kickstarter campaigns. Our 8 previous campaigns (10' to kill, Outlive, Clash of Rage 1 & 2, Neta-Tanka, It's a Wonderful World, It's a Wonderful World - Ascension, and Daimyo) were a success. All the games have been produced and successfully delivered. 

We try our best to stay close to our community through Kickstarter comments, private messages and through our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/laboitedejeu/). We really do take your feedback into account, and love interacting with our community. It's a Wonderful Kingdom has already been fully designed and playtested. 

We are close to ready to launch the production just after the Campaign end. We estimate a delivery date around January 2022. This corresponds to the necessary time to prepare the game for manufacturing, produce it and ship it. It also includes a safety margin, in case we come across any unforeseen circumstances. It is in our best interest to get the game to our backers as soon as possible and we will do our utmost to ensure that there are no delays, or better yet, that we can deliver ahead of time if good fortune prevails.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
[French below]
Free people of our Wonderful Kingdom,
Hello,

Since the end of the campaign, we didn't keep you so well informed, all our apologies. Our team was fully focused on its work to deliver this wonderful game as soon as possible! A lot of our export partners that already worked with us on It's a Wonderful World followed us on this project as well, and we would like to really thank them!

A new hope
Free people of our Wonderful Kingdom,
From the far-off lands of the Kingdom, the rumor is going around. In every village, every town, every tavern, the rumor is spreading. And up to the ears of the Duchess and the Duke, the rumor is resounding. Spies are confirming that the Black Dragons are gone, the Sisters of Misery are defeated. The Syphons, Thieves, Giant Rats, the Giants, the Pestilent Lord… everything has been swept.

Dark hours
Free people of our Wonderful Kingdom,
The Kingdom is ruined, wasted by the war, threatened by menaces and monsters, and with no Monarch on the throne. There’s nothing left to govern. Personal ambitions led us to ruin.

Back to business
Free people of our Wonderful Kingdom,
Senada laid the weapons down and the Duchies of Valados and Terressie must now think about the future. War has been long, everybody wants peace, but will they come to a consensus despite their strong egos?

A new alliance
Free people of our Wonderful Kingdom,
The troops of Senada suffered several setbacks on the battlefield. Lower in numbers, less organized and less armed, they’re losing ground.

Stuck in the Maze
Free people of our Wonderful Kingdom,
It appears that the Duchess of Terressie and the Duke of Valados have been imprisoned in the Maze of Fenhror. A terrible place, lost in the mountains of Senada, from which no one ever escaped!

The Great illusion

Free people of our Wonderful Kingdom,

The Duchy of Senada has been prospering at the extense of its two rivals. campaign.story:
Canvas: Reflections is an expansion to the critically acclaimed transparent card layering game, Canvas. 
In Canvas you layer transparent cards to create paintings. It is both a puzzling strategy game and a one-of-a-kind artistic experience. The expansion, Canvas: Reflections adds millions of unique combinations with its double-sided transparent cards.
Store it on your shelf or hang it on your wall!
Reversible Mirror Cards. Each card can be flipped to reverse the position of the icons. The artwork on each side has a different color scheme.
New game board. Players choose from 2 rows of Art Cards. This gives you a selection of 8 options, including a choice of 2 free Art Cards (for added flexibility when you're short on Inspiration Tokens).
Gold Bonus Ribbons. Grab a Gold Bonus Ribbon worth 3 points for lining up a specific Element next to a Gold Bonus icon.
8 New Scoring Cards for puzzling new challenges, intriguing new scoring synergies, and more replayability.
Signature Styles (Deluxe edition only). Each player begins the game with a different Signature Style. Score 2 points for each illustration of the shown type in one of your completed paintings.
Wood Tokens (Deluxe edition only). 16 screen-printed wood Ribbons with shiny metallic gold paint, plus 10 screen-printed wood Inspiration Tokens.
Ribbon Pins (Deluxe edition only). The player with the most points and the player with the best painting are awarded the Best In Show and Masterpiece ribbons.
 DELUXE EDITIONS | The Deluxe editions of Canvas and Canvas: Reflections will not be available in retail.
 EARLY DELIVERY | Get your copies of Canvas: Reflections and the 2nd print run of Canvas before they hit stores in your region. Canvas and its expansion may not be available in retail in every country.

In the previous Canvas campaign, backers came up with concepts for 3 of the Mini-Expansion cards. This time, our artist Luan brought 10 of your ideas to life onto the 10 bonus reversible Mirror Cards in Canvas: Reflections (Deluxe Edition). Thanks for all your input!
The 2nd printing of Canvas comes with ALL the stretch goals from the previous campaign. Below are all the component upgrades for Canvas: Reflections.

Risks and challenges
FULFILLMENT TIMELINE
Our previous games had an average delivery of 7 months after the campaign, so we are confident Canvas: Reflections can deliver in a similar time frame. The estimated delivery date for this project is February 2022, though delays are always a possibility. Due to the logistics of international shipping, some backers may receive their rewards sooner than others.

LOST SHIPMENTS, LATE SURVEYS & REFUND POLICY
If your order is lost or returned due to unforeseen circumstances, we will attempt to reship your game one time, free of charge. If you provided incorrect shipping information, you will be responsible for the reshipment fee. If your order cannot be delivered, we will refund your order completely, including fees.

Reshipments and late survey shipments will all be sent out at the same time, about 3 months after the start of fulfillment to simplify the logistics and avoid errors resulting from sending numerous single orders.

This campaign will close 3 months after the start of fulfillment. If you do not provide shipping information by that time, we can not fulfill your order and your pledge will be kept as a donation to the campaign.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Canvas: Reflections will be printed on high quality, durable components. The sleeves that come with the game are not only essential for gameplay, they also help increase the lifespan of the cards. Canvas was designed with expansions in mind, so that Canvas: Reflections and future expansions will not require unnecessary duplicate printing of base game components.
Reusability and recyclability
Our manufacturer, PandaGM, will produce replacement components so that damaged or missing pieces can be replaced with a small shipment instead of a second copy of the game, saving gas and materials. Canvas components are stored in reusable storage bags. The box efficiently holds all game pieces and add-ons without wasted space from a plastic insert.
Sustainable materials
The box and punchboard are made from 30% recycled materials for the ideal blend of durability and sustainability. The cards are made with materials from FSC certified sources. Components are printed with eco-friendly water-based ink and varnish. Our premium components are made from wood instead of plastic. The packing cartons are 100% recycled paper pulp.
Environmentally friendly factories
PandaGM recycles all plastic and paper waste. The factory is fully air-conditioned for worker comfort and has passed ISO worker health and safety standards, is BSCI social compliance certified, and follows the OHSAS requirements for occupational health and safety. Their project management and customer service teams all work remotely, which has a major impact on their carbon footprint.

updates.update_content:
What we've been up to this month
PRE-PRODUCTION
Pre-production is moving fast! Luan finished polishing all the illustrations and I've been getting everything built and exported in InDesign. After an obnoxious amount of proofreading, we sent everything to the manufacturer. The manufacturer gave us digital proofs, which are digital files with all the images laid out in their printing templates, and we have approved and signed off on them so that they can move forward with the sample copies of the games.

THANK YOU!!!
We still can't believe it, but because of all your overwhelming support, the Canvas: Reflections campaign has become R2i Games' most funded Kickstarter campaign! Andrew and I are thankful every day for this community that allows us to do what we love most. We're so excited to share Canvas and Canvas: Reflections with you, and we can't wait to share even more creative, beautiful, and entertaining board games in the future. Thank you for supporting Canvas: Reflections. And an extra special thank you to everyone who has supported our games over the years.
Project Updates

Final Hours
The Canvas 2nd Printing & Expansion campaign comes to a close Tuesday, May 11 at 11:59 PM CDT.  We've been so humbled by all the support you all have shown through this campaign and we hope this momentum continues to a strong finish!
All Community Designed Cards are Complete!

Rulebook Updates 
Thanks for all your help with the rulebook. We made some improvements based on your suggestions, so check out the updated rulebook. Also, one fun little improvement we added was Scenario Goals. Each of the Scenario setups now has a point goal needed to pass the Scenario. You can play these with any player count, and I find it especially fun and challenging as a solo campaign. Can you complete them all?
Playtesters Wanted!

Seeking Rulebook Proofreaders
We think the Canvas: Reflections rulebook is pretty close to completion, but we need new sets of eyes to look it over and make sure everything is perfect. If you're interested in proofreading, check out the Reflections Rulebook and leave your feedback in the comments of this update. Note that you should be familiar with the base game rules before reading the expansion rules. We appreciate the help! 
Vote for Your Favorite Titles

Vote for your favorite Illustrations
Jeff and I went through ALL of the amazing illustration ideas you submitted over the past week and selected our top picks. Now it is your turn to choose your 5 favorites! Head to the poll posted on BoardGameGeek and vote for your favorite submissions. The polls will close on Friday the 23rd and the illustrations with the highest number of votes will be added to Canvas: Reflections (Deluxe)! 
Community Designed Card #2

Reminder to Submit Your Illustration Ideas
Monday is the last day to submit your illustration ideas for the 10 bonus Art Cards in Canvas: Reflections (Deluxe). We posted a thread to BoardGameGeek where you can submit your ideas. Next, backers will vote for their 5 favorites (we'll post a poll in a campaign Update), and Andrew and I will choose our 5 favorites. Finally, our illustrator Luan Huynh will bring these ideas to life!
Community Designed Card #1

FUNDED!!!
Wow! We are OVERWHELMED by your support on this campaign. The Canvas: Reflections campaign was funded in 24 minutes, and in less than 24 hours there are just about 6,000 backers! Thank you, thank you, thank you from the bottom of our hearts for making this expansion possible. Seriously we can't say it enough -- THANK YOU.

campaign.story:
Ghost Writer is an elegant 15-minute party game for word and puzzle game enthusiasts. Renowned Mediums race to figure out a secret object that their teammate—a Spirit—is trying to communicate. But there's a catch: your opponent Medium sees every clue your Spirit writes, and can use these to figure out the secret object first. Spirits have to give creative clues that aren’t too obvious. Mediums need to deduce, ask good questions, and call off the communications before the other Medium learns too much.
When you think you know the clue, call out Silencio to stop the Ghost Writer!
Ghost Writer's components and assets are close to done, but could still end up looking different from the ones pictured

Split into two teams: the Sun and the Moon team. Choose 1 player on each team to be the Spirit. The Spirits get to know the Secret Object.
Spirits draw a single Object card, and choose the Secret Object together
On your turn, ask your Spirit a Question about the Secret Object:
Only your team gets to see the Question card you choose!
Your Spirit writes the answer to the Question, but here's the catch: you call "Silencio" when you think you know what your Spirit is writing, and they stop writing.  
Call Silencio early, so that your opponents can't learn too much from your clue!
You can learn from the other team’s answers even though you can’t see their questions.

When you think you know what the Secret Object is, you spend your turn to write your guess on the pad. If you're right, your team wins! Otherwise the game continues

Poetry Slam is a 3-8 Player party game that plays in 25-45 minutes.  The simple game play combined with clever scoring make this a brilliant casual game for gamers and non-gamers alike.
Never-before seen Deluxe Version for just $5!
This project is a special 10-day project for "pledge what you are able".  We are offering a fixed number of rewards to get the game out there with just 1000 of the Deluxe Version with a minimum pledge of $5.  We encourage you to pledge what you are able, but if $5 is all you can pledge, that is ok for us.  This is a crazy experiment to see if "seeding the market" will pay off for future print runs!  Note shipping costs and add-ons will be collected post-campaign during the Crowdox Survey process.
 CRAZY Pricing! To be honest, we LOVE this game, but it failed on Kickstarter last time at $40/copy (HERE).  We had a brilliant looking project, good reviews and everything looked great, but wow did it fail!  Rather than just let this project die we have teamed up with the factory to reboot this game.  We are going to produce  1000 copies of the Deluxe game.  We are doing the Deluxe game with ALL stretch goals unlocked and asking you backers to pay what you can.  We know the world is a crazy place right now and lots of us are hurting.  We are strictly limiting this campaign to just a few copies and will NEVER produce the Deluxe edition again!  
 KS Limited Exclusive Content! Deluxe copies will NOT enter distribution. Don't miss out on these awesome extras. 
 Stretch Rewards! All stretch rewards are UNLOCKED and every copy of the game will come with all the stretch rewards mentioned!
https://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/247576/poetry-slam
Step One: Reveal a Letter Card and a Word Prompt, then all players simultaneously write a word behind their screen that fits the rule (sorta like Scattergories but with only one word):
 Step 2: When you have completed your word grab a Speed Tile, first come first served!
 Step 3: Using the word you created from Step 1, form a simple poem to clue in your fellow players as to your word.
Hint: The poem should be sort of like clues from Dixit, not so easy that someone can guess it before you even finish with your poem, in that case you only get two points. It also shouldn't be so hard that no one can guess it, then you get no points. You want it to be difficult but not too difficult, so at least one person guesses correctly after you finish the poem for 3 points!
Two final details: Snap Tokens. You must give three +1 point Snap Tokens to other players during the game, but no more than one per round. You also accumulate Slam Tokens when you break rules or use forbidden letters.

campaign.story:
In Scrumpy: Card Cider, you become the owner of your own cider-making company as you race to sell the most cider before your competitors, in this innovative and highly replayable, deck manipulation game for 1 - 4 players.
This fresh and crisp strategy game reinvents the deck-building genre with multi-use cards that have can be either played for their action or tucked face-down to become one of the 5 resources in the game.
Rather than trashing cards to optimise your deck, manipulate your cards to ensure your most powerful abilities cycle through and into your hand, whilst keeping the ones not as useful to your strategy tucked as resources.

artwork not final

Each card as part of your deck has 3 functions:
 Core Action: a plethora of core actions are available, each card has one unique ability.
 Secondary Action: basic workers can also be used for their secondary action, shown in the top-right corner of the card
 Represent Resources: the reverse of each card in your deck is also used to represent 5 resources in the game: apples, wood, cider bottles, or empty and full cider barrels.
Scrumpy focuses on "deck-manipulation" where you manage the flow of cards in and out of your storehouse. 
The deck itself also acts as a resource limit and you have to be careful not to overproduce or risk damaging your action efficiency.
Simple turns make for a continuous gameplay experience where turns progress quickly and downtime is low. After two or three plays, you will even find players overlapping turns for increased efficiency.
The game is also highly interactive meaning you are never left disengaged, even in a 4-player game. Plan your next turn, keep an eye on who is close to completing orders or goals or plan the best use of the Exchange Student you have in your hand.


An elegantly integrated upgrade system where each order you complete with a vendor permits you to upgrade one of the 11 upgrade locations on your storehouse/orchard.
Upgrades increase the efficiency of your owner actions, allow you to plant more trees and increase your resource production efficiency.
CURRENT STRETCH GOAL 
One of the more unique elements of our stretch goals we can reveal now is the Artist Boost. As you can find out in the Scrumpy Team section, our extremely talented artist Bernie Todd, who was only 13 when she started this project is still a college student and we want to help her out. Alongside game upgrades and stretch goals for backers we also will be hoping to unlock artist boost levels to provide an additional financial bonus on top of the money she has already been paid, to help her with further education.
 SOCIAL GOALS

Thanks to the social efforts of many Scrumpy: Card Cider backers, the game will be coming with Storehouses that are dual-layered with recessed spaces for upgrade cubes and gaps for sliding the cards underneath.

We completed the 7 social challenges below to unlock this exciting component upgrade FOR FREE.
(we will not increase the cost of the game on Kickstarter by adding this deluxe component to the base game)
 Click here to go straight to our Facebook launch post 
 Click here to go straight to our Facebook page
  Click here to visit our Instagram page
  Click here to follow our Kickstarter profile
Click here to retweet our Twitter Launch tweet.
 Click here and click the ❤️ to become a fan of the game
Click here to subscribe to the Youtube channel
PLAY

Scrumpy is a strategic card game for 1-4 players. The game is played over a maximum of 6 rounds, sometimes fewer. Each round has 2 phases: Actions and Refresh.
In the Actions phase, players take turns to perform four Core Actions and optional Auxiliary Actions.
In the Refresh phase, the game is reset for the next round unless an End Game Condition has been achieved.
Your objective is to gain the most Prestige from actions like selling cider, achieving Goals, and recruiting a highly-skilled workforce.
AUXILIARY ACTION (Optional)
At the start of your turn you may perform one of the following auxiliary actions, or pass and move onto your core action:
 Sell cider to a vendor: If you have, in your storehouse, the required bottles or barrels, you may sell to one of the available vendors and also remove an upgrade cube from your storehouse or orchard, placing it on that vendor and receiving coins or prestige.
 Secondary action: all the basic workers in your deck (the cards you start with) have a secondary action - depicted in the top right-hand corner - and they can be converted directly into the resource shown: apple, wood or coin. Simple flip and tuck the card as the resource in question (or discard if gaining a coin from the supply)
 Sell one resource: you can sell one resource by discarding the card and gaining coins equal to its value
CORE ACTION (Worker)
As your core action, you may perform one of the follow three actions:
 Worker Action: play one card from your hand face-up into the first available of the three slots in your storehouse, and perform it's action:
 Recruit: You may recruit one available skilled/master worker from the roster by paying the cost. Play that card into the first available of the three slots in your storehouse, and perform its action.
 Gain Idle Layabout: Gain a grey idle layabout card from the supply for free and play that card into the first available of the three slots in your storehouse. You do not perform an action but you gain a coin.
CORE ACTION (Owner)
Once per round, instead of playing a card, you may move your owner meeple and perform the action selected from the owner's office in your storehouse:
REFRESH PHASE
Once all players have played four actions (3 workers and 1 owner), refresh for the next round:
 Remove your Owner meeple from the Owner Action space it used this round, placing it back on the seat. 
Discard all Worker cards from the Worker spaces in your Storehouse.
 Refresh your hand according to the hand limits shown on your Storehouse:
  GAME END
After 6 rounds have been completed, or one player has upgraded all locations on their storehouse (whichever occurs first), the game ends.
Then, use the Scorepad to calculate final scores by adding up:
The value of all Prestige tokens collected during the game.
The Prestige of Private and Public Goals achieved.
The Prestige of Deliveries to Vendors.
One Prestige for each Skilled and Master Worker card in players’ decks.
One Prestige for every 8 coins. (Retain any leftover coins in case of a tie break.)
The player with the most prestige is the winner.
*rulebook subject to changes

 As we transition from hopeful campaign funding to manufacture and fulfilment, there are various tasks that need to be undertaken.
We will endeavour to maintain semi-regular updates without you growing fatigued by a full inbox and aiming towards the following targets.
Obviously, with Ships' potential to fail to negotiate canals and global carboard shortages, we cannot anticipate all eventualities but will do our utmost to keep you informed and aware should any delays occur. Any timeline is an estimate only.
If they are happening, we reserve the right to sell some copies of the game at UK conventions. We will endeavour to fulfil all copies before this. If there are any delays we may need to begin selling slightly before one or two copies are fulfilled to assist with cash flow. Should you wish to you can always pick up from these conventions if you are yet to receive your copy.
The last year has not been kind to board game retailers and we have been hugely supported by a variety of FLGS as we developed Scrumpy. We are happy to offer a Kickstarter retail pledge to any bricks and mortar stores and independent game retailers. Please back at the retail pledge and contact us where we will be happy to share with you our retail rates and see what other things we can do to support you with being able to stock the game.

your store's email address and store address
which country you are based in

We reserve the rights to place order limits on Kickstarter copies of games. We are also unwilling to provide copies to anyone offering pre-orders while the campaign is live. 

Group Pledges
We want to help as many of you to enjoy Scrumpy as we can. Global shipping can be an issue on this front and so, we are happy for groups of 6 or more people who wish to have the games sent to one location to contact us for a group pledge rate. 
Unfortunately, due to weights and taxes, different locations will have different prices so please contact us to find out how we can work together.
Estimated shipping cost only
Actual shipping costs may be different from estimates, we will endeavour to secure the best rates possible as close to fulfilment as possible and to pass any savings directly on to backers.
In very rare cases the shipping price can be significantly higher than the early estimates. We reserve the right to cancel any order and will offer a full refund in these cases.
 Unfortunately, the law also requires us to pay tax in some countries and we will need to charge VAT or similar taxes at the end of the campaign. For example: In the UK you will need to pay an additional tax of £6.60 VAT. The easiest way to look at this is that MRSP is £40 so the lower pledge will still be below this once you pay VAT. In the US there will be no such tax to pay in many states.
Invincible Games is a new small independent UK-based publisher that has been formed to produce Scrumpy: Card Cider and - hopefully - many more games to come. We are a small team of only 2 permanent staff members and a handful of freelancers. We have spent the past 4 years developing Scrumpy, investing our own time and money into the project, to get to this point. We're super proud of what we've achieved and sincerely hope you share our love for Scrumpy and join our family as a backer today.

If you want to find out more about us, check out our team biographies below:

Publisher and Game Designer
From an early age, Paul would often be found immersed in the land of board games, whether he was insisting his mother serve him from a kerplunk tube or taking an age to walk to school as he could only move forward when he rolled a 4 or better.
  Since Paul first started to develop his ideas for Scrumpy, he has been blessed with a young daughter who takes up a lot of his time in the best ways imaginable. Who wouldn't prefer to be crawling through canvas tunnels with an eleven-month-old than working? 
  Scrumpy has taken 4 years, a pandemic, a daughter and the setting up of a maths teaching Youtube channel to fully develop but Paul is excited to be finally at the stage where is ready to be released into the wild.
  This is Paul's first global release but he hopes it will not be his last with prototypes about smuggling in Cornwall, a dice school, a floristry game and a Euro game set inside the Hippo Falls safari park just some of the prototypes on his development list.  

Publisher and Head of Art & Graphics
Denholm began his career in board-gaming working as a general assistant for Stuff By Bez in 2019. He worked extensively on the Kickstarter campaigns for Wibbell++ & Kittycataclysm, whilst also entertaining a successful acting and theatre-producing career. He is also a self-taught graphic designer; board games have been an excellent way for Denholm to hone his skills in an applied setting.  
Denholm met Paul Frohnsdorff-Harris at HandyCon - a board gaming convention that Paul founded and runs - and their professional relationship grew from there. Initially Denholm came on board as a graphic designer but eventually, the partnership grew and he has since been integral in the development and delivery of this project. 
Denholm also works as a junior developer for Alley Cat Games, leading the development of Paper Dungeons, and assisting on Tinners' Trail and Eternal Palace. His first independent game Dice Cruise being released by Talon Strikes Studios in 2022.
  Despite her burgeoning talent as an artist. Bernie is still a college student. She first started this project at the age of 13 under the watchful guise and support of her father, himself an artist in the RPG world. 
  Understandably, this is Bernie's first major board game project having only provided support with RPG illustrations. Recently she also got a commission for Typhon, a game setting for a book.
  Bernie also streams some of her art and gaming on Twitch under the username Jozebean. She would appreciate any increase in followers that she receives.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a good working relationship with our manufacturers in China who will be working with us through a company in the UK to assist with a punctual and high-quality response.

As with any Kickstarter project, unpredictable events can take place. Global events such as the pandemic have affected everything from Manufacture and Shipping to the availability of cardboard. The estimated delivery date allows some extra time to account for delays, but it can only ever be an estimate.

Whatever happens, we will keep backers in the loop via project updates, and rewards will be delivered, as soon as we are able.

Above all we are human and while the best attempt will be made to deliver a wonderful product to you promptly and of the best quality, mistakes may happen. We will always work with you to find the best solution we can to any problems that should arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
As long as it's taken care of, we hope that one copy of the game should last a family a lifetime and into the beyond times. Indeed, we hope that your grandchildren will be able to play Scrumpy: Card Cider with their grandchildren.
Sustainable materials
The game is predominantly card, cardboard and wood, all of which are designed to restrict the amount of non-recyclable waste. 

All components will come in a box where effort has been made to cut out single-use plastics. Each box has been designed to include tuck boxes for all components and a suggested configuration for optimal use. The game largely relies on cards and we understand that some people will choose to sleeve them so all tuck boxes are designed to be big enough to fit sleeved cards if necessary.

"What about a plastic wrap?" We hear you ask. All cards will ship with paper bands around them and 4 paper-based seals on the boxes instead of the plastic wraps that many games come in. We cannot eliminate plastics altogether but it is our intent to do what we can.
Something else
We plan to make a tree-planting replacement donation to the 'Fruit tree Planting Foundation' to attempt to offset both the manufactured materials and any carbon footprint created.

Hello!

We're still working on getting the drawings digitised and ready for print; I'll share updates here as and when they happen. There's also plans for a bonus, super cool card-related project (all together now: oooooh!) which I'll reveal further down the line, when I have physical decks ready to go.

updates.update_userinfo: So, I guess we reached the target...
updates.update_content:
Hello! So, for those who don't follow me on Twitter (sensible), let me say this once more: five times the target?!? In under a week! And the total is still slowly climbing! To misquote Elton John, it's a mad, mad situation (and it is indeed getting more and more absurd).

Just  a polite little notice to say firstly, a huge thank-you, obviously. There was a point where this was the third most popular Art Kickstarter in the WORLD, I was able to say things like 'I could send you a link or you could just google Kickstarter, I'm on the home page' - Bruce Dessau even wrote about my project.

campaign.story:
Survival Evolved!
A Whole New Board Royale Experience For All
Board Royale has been a super cutthroat survival card game where you fight against your friends until there is one survivor remains. Not anymore! We are presenting new collaborative and peaceful competitive expansions that will add a new meaning to survival.
Board Royale is about to become a truly sandbox game that can be played by all types of players and playstyles!
YES, we are talking about wild beasts, the army of the dead, and secret agendas.
Let’s get to know the Board Royale base game and our new expansions!
What did we change?
We're excited to announce that we have updated our base game with several changes. Thanks to our previous backers and all players around the world for their amazing feedback. With their guidance, we've added new items to increase our base game item count from 80 to 100. New weapons, fun disguise items, and a more balanced Board Royale Experience for all. If you already have a base game please check out the returning backer section for the included base game update package.

Board Royale became an adventure beyond our imaginations.  Another shout out to our all previous backers and players around the world! Thank you, for constantly reminding us to add a collaborative gameplay experience. We've heard your call. We waited until we're completely satisfied with the expansion tests.
Click to download on the App Store
Click to download on the Google Play
Survival 101: This pack is perfect if you want to have a taste of the original Board Royale before you commit to the expansions. It includes the new Board Royale base game in its retail box and our new Kickstarter Exclusive Secret Weapons expansion that will never be sold again.
Returning Survivor: This pack is designed for the survivors that are already on our island. If you have the base game in your hands and want to add our new expansions, this pack is made for you. They will all fit in our Kickstarter exclusive box. And this pack includes the base game update deck that will include only the renewed cards from the new base game. It does NOT contain the complete base game!
New Survival Pack: This pack is designed for new survivors that haven’t owned Board Royale yet. If you want to have the base game, all five of our new expansions plus our mini backpack. You will have all the competitive, collaborative & peaceful expansions in one pack.
The Ultimate Survivor: This pack is for those who are new to the island and want the complete survival experience with all aspects!. Our new base game, four previous expansions, five new expansions plus a mini travel backpack. All inside one giant box that can store all cards sleeved!
Collector's Edition: Our Collector’s Edition is truly a piece of craftsmanship. The box is huge and covered with vegan leather. Inside, there is a soft velvety texture housing our new base game and our four previous and five new expansions. There were only 250 Collector’s Editions declared for Board Royale - The Island. 150 of them were given previously. In this campaign, the last 100 are available for you to grab. All serial numbers are individually engraved on the boxes.
 We have created all our offerings as add-ons so that you can customize your pledge as you please. You can add these now on Kickstarter after selecting your reward or just after the campaign from our pledge manager BackerKit.
Upgrade your box to Survival Crate: One of the most requested items has been a box that can easily store all our cards sleeved! You can upgrade the box of your reward to a survival crate if you are going to sleeve your cards!
Note: Survival 101 (only Base game) reward cannot be upgraded to survival crate.
We are an early-stage start-up with passion. We want to make the world's most creative and innovative games while staying true to our values.
This is why we need people with different ideas, different tastes, and different play-styles. However, without your help, we won’t be able to reach more than 1% of the people that would like to be on this journey with us.
If you want to help us spread the word, please; 
 Share this campaign with your Facebook friends or groups and tell them what you think about Board Royale!
   Follow, retweet, or mention Board Royale in your Tweets.
   Share your Board Royale moments on Instagram and let your followers know that this game is suitable for everyone!
   Mention us on your favorite subreddit if you see a related post or make a post about us.

Any of these are incredibly valuable to us. So that, as a token of our gratitude, we will add your name to our “Special Thanks” section on our printed rulebook if you back us on this campaign and make a post about Board Royale on any platform! Give us a heads up with your post through e-mail (community@arvisgames.com) or send a direct message so that we won’t miss it! Thank you already for your support! 
We are planning to deliver a huge majority of our products within 7 months after the campaign is over. We are also very excited to play with new expansions as well and want to complete all expansions as fast as possible!
We try to be customs friendly in many countries so that you won’t be surprised with unforeseen taxes but this process may take longer in some countries.
We kept our pricing ranges as estimated in our previous campaign even though the pandemic caused our shipping prices to be dramatically higher. All prices in the shipping chart are given as US$ and will be charged via pledge manager after the campaign by our partner Backerkit. If you want to learn more about pledge manager and our partner Backerkit please feel free to check this link. 
Arvis is one of the oldest known terms that means “Magic”. Our goal is to create memory worthy experiences for all players that seek unique and well-designed games. Arvis Games is a multinational company established and operating in both Canada & Turkey and has a diverse team of professionals from the game industry.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you've scrolled all the way down here, you are considering to back us seriously, Thanks a lot for that! ( Or if you already pledged! Thank you very much! And welcome to the Island! :) 

This project is our 2nd Kickstarter and we are proud to say that we delivered our first product during this difficult pandemic environment. The Covid-19 outbreak started while we were ramping up production and once the production finished, the whole world was in full lockdown. We managed to ship every reward while civilization was at a pause. During these hard times, we learned to overcome any challenge that might come on our way. And for the sake of transparency, we always kept our backers updated in advance, during the whole process.

Even though we have learned a lot about production and logistics in the past year, there may be still unforeseen problems. However, we can assure you we will do our best to adapt and react quickly to every issue and we will be transparent regarding the state of your pledge.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We use the best quality materials we can get. We also create update decks as we update our games so that it won't be necessary to buy a whole new pack to enjoy the latest version.
Sustainable materials
We try to minimize the use of plastic in our game. We make sure wild forests were not damaged during the paper making process and we try to use FSC certificated paper in the places that we can.
Sustainable Distribution
We ship our goods to at least 7 local warehouses around the world to minimize the Carbon Footprint of our fulfillment operations.

campaign.story:
Your Garden Awaits
Spend the afternoon in your floriferous garden. Pour a cup of tea, relax, and enjoy this elegant game of picking, pairing, and arranging flowers. Find joy in the abundance of nature.          
In Floriferous, your objective is to score the most victory points by collecting flowers and pairing them with Arrangement, Desire, and Bounty Cards.      
 Simple, easy-to-learn rules welcome all players to the table.
 Gorgeous cards and collection-driven scoring create beautiful & compelling choices every turn.
 Smooth, streamlined turns selecting flowers makes Floriferous a fast-moving, fun, set collection game.  
Steve Finn of Dr. Finn's Games - renowned designer of Biblios, Herbaceous, and Sunset Over Water - has created a wonderful complement to Clémentine Campardou's stunning, watercolor artwork. Eduardo Baraf of Pencil First Games is at the helm of Floriferous to ensure it is the perfect balance of easy play, compelling choices, and wonderful art in a fantastic package.    
Keith Matejka of Thunderworks Games - designer of Roll Player, Skulk Hollow, and the single player variants in both Herbaceous and Sunset Over Water - created the excellent "The Pesky Guest" solo gameplay for Floriferous.   
The Early Spring Mini-Expansion adds various single turn actions to create new movements within your floriferous garden.
All Kickstarter backers who pledge for Floriferous will also receive the Early Spring Mini-Expansion for FREE. This expansion will be available for sale after the Kickstarter, but will not be packaged within the base game.   
Click for the full preview.

Game Enthus: “Floriferous is a fun word to say... floriferous... floriferousfloriferous... fun game too.”
Click for full article!
The Lobby of Hobbies: Floriferous has neat little layers of strategy that are very welcoming to new and even experienced gamers...I will be backing. It will find a spot right on my shelf right next to The Whatnot Cabinet and Herbaceous.
During our original Herbaceous campaign, we unlocked numerous stretch goals that set the bar for the quality and completeness of this line of products. The Sunset Over Water stretch goals & campaign maintained that bar. For Floriferous we've decided to simply build the game we hope / believe should be delivered from the get go. All of the "Stretch Goals" are already unlocked and included upon funding.
International shipping has been increasingly complicated and expensive year after year, including additional requirements to deliver EU, UK, and CA Friendly service.  We fully expect to see additional increases to shipping. If you are able to purchase an additional copy or copies with some friends, you'll have a better price per copy on shipping.  Floriferous will be EU, UK, and CANADA Friendly.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
"Floriferous" is Pencil First Games' thirteenth board game Kickstarter. "Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet!", "The Siblings Trouble", "GemPacked Cards", "Heroes and Tricks", "Herbaceous", "Legendary Creatures", "Sunset Over Water", "Herbaceous Sprouts", "Heroes Welcome, "Skulk Hollow," "The One Hundred Torii," and "The Whatnot Cabinet" all successfully funded and shipped to backers. "Herbaceous: Pocket Edition" is shipping to backers in April. We strive to run excellent Kickstarters and deliver fantastic products.

"Floriferous" is well-tested and balanced. The graphic design is complete and the card art is final. Box and instructions are near final and we have been working closely with our printer. Limited amounts of work will remain based on how the KS unfolds.

There are inherent risks whenever undertaking a project as complex and large as producing and distributing a board game, but we have over 6 years of experience dealing with these. We've gone out of our way to surround ourselves with experienced board game developers, distributors, and people who have run and launched successful Kickstarters. This team of friends has been exceedingly supportive and we're sure will help as we hit any upcoming bumps in the road. And there are bumps. Strikes, shortages, and shipping delays are all hard to predict.

Most importantly, if something does go wrong, we will keep everyone in the loop as the project moves forward and comes to market. This game will exist because you all will have made it happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The game is played over four seasons (spring, summer, fall, and winter) with each season having two phases (day and night). During the Day Phase, players will deploy five workers onto the City Board. Each worker placed with earn goods and may also permit the player to take a Lantern Action. During the Night Phase, players will sell their goods to customers.
Day Phase
Players will place workers on to Districts or Lantern Districts in turn order out into the city to collect goods.
When workers are placed in a specific pattern, combos are created which generates additional goods. 
Double Combo
Gain two goods the one you place on and the one in between.
Triple Combo
Gain three goods, one good for each worker in a row.
Lantern Action
When a worker is placed on a Lantern District, the player may forgo taking goods and instead take a Lantern Action - Hire Chef, Build Stalls, Attract Customers.
Hire Chef
Pay the cost under the left-most Chef Meeple on your Player Board. Then immediately place the Chef Meeple onto any District and take the matching Good along with any combos that you triggered. Remember that Chef Meeples DO NOT perform Lantern Actions and they may only collect the good. Your Chef will now function like a worker when making combos!
Build Stalls
To build Stalls, pay the amount shown under the Marker Cube on your Player Board in the "Build Stalls" row, then move the cube one space to the right. Take any two stalls of your choice from the stall display and place them on any open space on YOUR Player Board. Once placed they may not be moved.
Attract Customers
To attract a customer take any single Customer from the display. Place that Customer on the left-most available customer space on the bottom of your Player Board. You must pay the cost that is covered up.
NIGHT PHASE
During the Night Phase, players will be simultaneously be placing their goods onto Stalls, Signature Stalls, and Delivery Scooter locations.
Blue Stall is a regular stall. A Yellow, Purple, Green, or Red stall is considered a signature stall.
Placing Goods
You may place your goods into any of the stalls that you have in your market.
You want to place goods in your stalls to fulfill the customers you have since they will be looking in particular places for goods. Once you have placed all the goods that you have into available stalls and scooter locations, you may sell the goods to the customers and tally the money you made.
At the end of a season, all players will evaluate their progress to see who won the season bonus. This will set the player order for the next season.
The Rulebook is a living document and is constantly being updated and refined. Before printing the rule book will undergo professional editing and testing.
Read the Rules Here
The Solo and Multi-Player Experience is a welcomed addition to this wonderful worker placement game. The success of the Night Market has caught the attention of other businesses in the area and AI Mart is looking to take customers away from the Night Market. 
AI Mart will challenge players to not only seek out the best strategies while moving through the four seasons it will also play differently each time you sit down to play. Sturdy high-quality components will help to drive this experience to a wonderful game state that you will want to come back to again and again.
Multiplayer Competitive Mode with Automa
Automa will be played with two or three players. 
Multiplayer Competitive Mode with Human Operated Automa
Multi players in competitive mode is where you would have 2 to 3 players playing a normal game and one player is controlling the AI Mart to see which player wins.
Multiplayer Cooperative Mode
All VS One
In this version, players will work together to outscore and defeat the AI Mart from moving in on the Night Market.
Note: The Rulebook is a living document and is constantly being updated and refined. Before printing the rule book will undergo professional editing and testing.

The Festival Pack celebrates the four largest festivals that happen throughout the year. The Dragon Boat Festival, Lantern Festival, Mid-Autumn (Moon) Festival, and The Spring Festival. The Add-On Pack will come with different setups and scenarios for the players based on the festivals.
The Worker Skills Expansion will give your workers asymmetrical skills. Each player will have the opportunity to give their workers skills to enhance their play. These skills are unique and once acquired you get to keep the power for the remainder of the game. This will add another crunchy layer of gaming goodness to the Night Market Experience.
The Market Experience is truly special in Night Market. If you are a solo player and enjoy euro-style games this is one you do not want to miss. The solo player is very challenging and the replay on this solo version is high. It also includes a fabulous Multi-Player Competitive Mode against Automa and Co-Op against Automa. There are Multiple Modes of play.

 The Scooter Expansion will replace the after-hours scooter use in the base game and replace it with a much more robust delivery system using scooters. In this expansion, you will place your scooters out onto the city board for delivery bonuses. We will also introduce a NEW signature dish!
The Arcade Expansion will highlight the stall games that are in night markets. From Shooting Hoops to Dart to scoping Shrimp there are all kinds of games. In this expansion, the player will have the chance to place these game stalls in their markets for bonuses during and at the end of the game.
How to pledge with an Add-On
If you wish to get one of the Add-Ons for your Basic or Deluxe Pledge simply add the dollar amount of the add-on you would like to your pledge.
For example, you chose the Basic Pledge and you want the Solo Experience as well just add 12 dollars to your pledge total for $62.00. In Pledge Manager you will be able to choose the Add-On and place it in your cart!

Anyone who enjoys brain teasers, abstract strategy games, math, and logic games, or even sudoku, will find that DOCE has all you need: refined strategies and tactics that come to light from smooth rules. You will find that materialization engaging, and even delightful.
Doce is a unique abstract strategy game. It's a turn-based, two-player game. And now you can play it anywhere in the world, with an Internet connection.
Take turns placing dice on the playing grid with the goal of making a line of 4 dice that add up to 12, but you have to follow some unique rules that will definitely pose a challenge to even the most astute among you. It's a game of simple rules and at the same time very challenging and fun to play. The complexity, possibilities, and strategies can run very deep. That’s why DOCE can help people of all ages develop strategy, concentration, and reasoning skills. We believe this is of great advantage for everybody, especially for people who want to get a mental power up! 
This is one of our Doce Digital designs
Doce Classic has been played by enthusiasts since its successful Kickstarter campaign at the end of 2019. Yet this campaign is about creating the digital version, bringing Doce to the tip of your fingers. We're not leaving the tabletop version, Doce Classic, behind. That’s why we’ve included it as a bundle in one of our pledges. 
Now, with Doce Digital, the scorekeeping, game mechanics, and matchmaking are handled by the software, and you can play it on your trusty device with virtually any opponent around the world.
Molly vs Marley, Doce is for the whole family and friends! Almost everybody...




Sadly, the whole world is going through very tough times. Suppliers, prototype developers, playtesters, and game conventions have practically come to a halt. Like most small businesses, we all are facing a very difficult situation where the goal now is to find a steady foothold for the time to come.
Innovation might be the best tool to deal with this situation.  For us, we've decided to bring forward the development of DOCE Digital, the perfect complement of Doce Classic.
We, the Smart Iguana Games Team, have been working tirelessly on the Doce Digital Beta version of our DOCE Classic board game. We hope it becomes a wonderful resource for people all over the world: a fun, challenging, and engaging game that can be played with the safest of social distances.
We believe in the importance of giving our backers the opportunity to try the game with friends before committing to a pledge. The BETA version represents an essential piece on the road towards our goal and it's 100% operational for you to play and enjoy (check the link to the game right after the How-to-play video section). But the full version is not quite there… yet!
Our aim is to create a high-quality and feature-rich application, with the capability of challenging you to a "Human vs. PC" match.
Be one of the people responsible for helping to bring DOCE Digital to life by contributing to our campaign. We invite you to experience the challenge, brain power-up, and satisfaction this game will bring to you, your family, and your friends. And we encourage you to tackle the problems we’ve prepared for you at the end of this page.

* SPECIAL NOTICE *
We have added international shipping to the European Union, United Kingdom, Canada and Australia for all physical product rewards (Blu-Ray Early Bird and above)!! Please disregard comments in each reward tier that state that rewards only ship to the USA--we now ship internationally!!  See below for detailed information about shipping.
Crafting Arzium is a new documentary feature film about board game designer Ryan Laukat and his wife Malorie Laukat (the core team behind Red Raven Games). Follow the two creators as they attempt to bring their latest game called Now or Never to life!
What is Arzium? Arzium is the world setting of many of Red Raven’s games, including Near and Far, Above and Below, and Roam–among others. Arzium is a fantastical world filled with desert oases, lush pastures, turnip farms, amber mines, jagged mountains, glogos caverns, iron cities, and exotic flying continents! It is a world which has entertained and inspired thousands of gamers and which captures the imagination.
The idea for Crafting Arzium came about after the completion of The Game Designers documentary (our first project) and was directly inspired by that movie.

In The Game Designers we set out to capture as much as we possibly could about the world of modern board game design and we traveled near and far to collect numerous stories and interviews. We followed five main designers and interviewed over 70+ people in total. The result of that effort was a film that was far-reaching and touched on a lot of points regarding the subject.

For Crafting Arzium we thought that it would be fun to delve into the same topic, however, instead of casting a really wide net like we did last time, we wondered how “deep” we could go with just one individual. So we set out in our early pre-production stage and made a long list of designers who we potentially thought could work for the film. Over time the list got shorter and shorter (for different reasons) and we eventually decided to team up with Ryan and Malorie Laukat!
Collaborating with Ryan and Malorie was great from the start and has continued to be a great experience. For this film we wanted to find the right individuals who were willing to be open and honest about their challenges–both in regards to the games they made and also in real life matters. Ryan and Malorie were up to the task and have opened up and shared a lot of great information–which really shines through in the film.

Ryan and Malorie are also super talented. They bring a great passion and sensibility to every project they create and have inspired gamers for nearly a decade. It was for this reason that we also decided to make a film about them!
"Working with Eric on Crafting Arzium has been an exciting adventure, and it's been very gratifying to be involved. Eric puts so much heart and effort into the work he does. It's thrilling to see what he can create from the simple story of making board games. He has really captured the passion we feel about our work, and the challenges of our everyday life. We are so pleased to support Eric and hope you will too!"

- Ryan and Malorie Laukat
Crafting Arzium began filming in June of 2020 and we hope to complete all of the filming by summer 2021. We have edited approximately one hour of the movie thus far (February 2021) and hope to have the film completed shortly after our last day of filming. The film is currently in a rough-cut status and needs to address some outstanding items, including:

Filming the last few scenes
Editing the last few scenes
Revising the rough cut for optimal character/plot development
Refining the rough cut and locking in the final edit
Adding in more graphics from the world of Arzium
Adding in more animations from the world of Arzium
Adding in more music to nail the tone of the film
Adding opening and closing sequences
Adding "lower-thirds" (text to the film)
Balancing audio and building a clean aural experience
Purchasing music licenses
Color Correction
Image stabilization
Quality Control

With the funds raised from this Kickstarter, we can finish off these outstanding items for the movie and also complete all of the stretch goals. This has been a great project to work on and we want to deliver an awesome experience for all backers--with your help we can do just that!
All shipping to the US is free of charge.

International shipping for physical reward tiers ($33 and up): We ship to European Union, United Kingdom, Canada, and Australia ONLY.  It is a $30 USD flat fee for shipping to these locations and this shipping charge includes all charges (no additional charges will be added for things such as customs, duties, and taxes per region and/or country). Shipping for physical tiers ($33 and up) is not available for anywhere outside of US, EU, UK, Canada, and Australia, at present time.

Shipping for ALL add-ons is free of charge regardless of where you live. And we will ship add-ons to anywhere in the world (for digital reward tiers).
ATTENTION! For shares to count toward the share goals above, you must share this post here: Click here to visit the Official Facebook post!
The Game Designers was our first documentary project and was successfully funded on Kickstarter in March 2018 (view the Kickstarter here). We had a lot of great support from the community and we unlocked nearly all of the stretch goals. The Game Designers went on to be released on iTunes, Google Play, Amazon, and Vimeo.
The Game Designers followed the stories of five board game designers as they worked to develop their latest games. Numerous other designers were interviewed for the project as well and they informed and highlighted specific things about the journeys of the main characters. In total, over 70+ game designers, industry professionals, and other media personalities were interviewed for the project.
You can learn more about the The Game Designers at the official website or check out the official trailer.  The Game Designers was a huge passionate project--just like Crafting Arzium--and we really appreciated the help and support of the community to help bring it to life. We hope that you will enjoy it should you get a reward or add-on that includes the movie!
Hi, my name is Eric Rayl. I am the founder of Zoom Out Media and also the writer/director of Crafting Arzium (and The Game Designers). As you might have noticed, I am passionate about board games and movies! I like to tell fun and entertaining stories about different types of creative people and to share their journeys. And so I am super excited to bring Crafting Arzium to the world and to show the awesome talent of Ryan & Malorie Laukat.
Director Eric Rayl filming a greenscreen shot with Ryan.
You can learn more about Zoom Out Media at our website or visit us on YouTube, Facebook, or Instagram!
We would love to have your support in helping us to spread the word about Crafting Arzium! We can only reach so many people by ourselves and we need YOU to help us get the word out there. We don't want anyone who plays tabletop games, or anyone who loves documentaries such as this, to miss out on this Kickstarter simply because they weren't aware of it. Can we count on you in helping us to share the project with your friends and family--and also on social media? Would you share the project so that more people can learn about the movie? Thank you so much!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We believe that the risks for this project are relatively low. About 90% of the footage for the project has already been shot and we are on target to get the rest of the film shot by the end of summer 2021. However, with all things related to film production, there are always surprises that can pop up at any time, so we will try to work through anything like that if it shall so arise. Hopefully we will be able to film the rest of the project and complete the movie and the stretch goals as planned!

campaign.story:
Modern mobile devices are getting smaller, smarter, and more useful. However, battery capacity is not keeping pace with the power demands of gaming, apps and advanced technologies like 5G. Unfortunately for users, this means carrying more chargers and backup batteries while on the go.
Low-battery anxiety is real and it keeps getting worse every day!
The only real solution is to have a compact, portable fast-charging power bank to reliably power up all the devices you use daily. It has to work fast, travel light, and fit seamlessly into your lifestyle!

STORM 2 provides a whole new charging experience unlike any other power bank.
Its Cyberpunk style transparent case marks the new era of power banks. The sci-fi display screen provides users total freedom and charging control. Equipped with an adjustable DC output, STORM 2 can charge up all your devices and gadgets safely and reliably. It handles all your charging needs with 2 USB-C charging ports that can quickly charge most modern electronics and a USB-A port for mobile devices.
Adjustable Voltage And Power Control
STORM 2’s on-display power management system visualizes the battery life, charge cycles, output distribution per battery cell, running temp, and DC voltage adjustment in a clear, concise, and intuitive way, giving you unparalleled control and access to all the information you need. Now, power is right at your fingertips.
For more details, please check out this hands-on video by Albert Torres.
 Seeing Is Knowing 
STORM 2 not only gives users the freedom of total control, but also complete transparency by displaying itself from the inside-out. The Cyberpunk style see-through design reveals its sophisticated circuit board, including the 32-bit M3 ARM MCU chip, and the contrast between chaotic electronic components and the perfect virtual world that it connects.
 For more details, please check out this hands-on video by iBertz.


STORM 2 easily satisfies the needs of travelers and digital nomads with a powerful 27600mAh / 99.36Wh capacity. While most power banks on the market suffer from low battery capacity or are too bulky to comfortably travel with, STORM 2 is a pocket-size powerhouse that has the maximum allowable capacity that still meets airline approval. It is compact, cost-efficient, and the perfect battery station to take anywhere in the world.
 Adjustable DC Output 
A dedicated 3.3-25.2V adjustable & customizable DC barrel port output meets all your specific device charging needs. STORM 2 is also the best choice when you are outdoors for running electric camp coolers, fans, shower water pumps, projectors, drones, or an electric soldering iron.

100W PD Fast-Charging USB Ports For All Devices
Featuring 100W PD Fast-Charging USB Ports compatible with all devices equipped with 100W PD fast-charging protocol, STORM 2 can fast-charge any electronic device anytime & anywhere via the two USB type-C & one USB A ports. Its 8 high power density lithium batteries can charge devices for up to a week.
For more details, please check out this hands-on video by EBPMAN.
The Only Charging Device You Need
STORM 2 supports fast-charging of 3 devices simultaneously. So you can charge your DJI drone with the DC port, MacBook Pro & iPhone with two USB-C ports, and your smart watch at the same time to boost your productivity. Take STORM 2 with you and leave all your other chargers at home.
Fully Recharge STORM 2 in Just 1.5 Hours
Larger battery capacity doesn’t mean a longer recharge time. With its 100W PD fast-charging DC input, there is no need to panic when your STORM 2 needs to recharge. Just 1.5 hours is enough to fully charge its 27600mAh/99.36Wh capacity.

Use It While Charging
The pass-through capability provides users with more charging convenience. It allows you to charge all your devices via the USB-C & USB-A ports while recharging STORM 2.
STORM 2 has a complete protection system built-in which includes Voltage Protection, Short Circuit, and Temperature Protection. It’s equipped with the safest Panasonic lithium battery pack approved by Tesla and V0 classification Fireproof PC Chassis. Safety is our first priority.

Arun-- Battery pack designer & supplier. Digital telecommunication company. 
Official website: http://arun.hk/
CARIT-- Built-in OS and display UI designer & supporter. Sub-brand of V-CHECKER. Area of business focused on automotive electronic technology and products. 
Official website: http://en.v-checker.com/
NAXIM-- Circuit and hardware designer. A newly registered company. The official website is still under construction. 
STORM 2 was born from a group of experienced hardware engineers and designers. Our team shares a common goal in starting the new era of everyday objects. This time, we are on a mission to deliver a powerbank with a revolutionary exterior and the most precisely designed interior to the consumer. It should also be convenient to carry and affordable to own. We believe that technology should make your life easier instead of trapping you with chargers. Tech optimizes your life, we optimize tech.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With our years of experience with products, our team is very confident with our product quality and shipping schedule for STORM 2 to ensure the best user experience.

However, there might be some hidden obstacles and challenges during production. Because of that, we’ve made sure to account for some amount of unforeseen problems that may occur in our schedule. We hold strong confidence that STORM 2 is well-prepared in order to provide a carefree experience throughout the campaign.

STORM 2 includes batteries, which makes it more difficult to ship. Therefore, the speed of shipping may vary from country to country especially under the worldwide pandemic outbreak. Our team will try our best to expedite the shipping and provide the best service for our backers after we reach our funding goal.

Please be aware that there may be extra customs fees due to the policy of different countries. Please check the local regulation of customs duties first. Backers need to take care of it by themselves.

If something does go wrong, we promise to keep our backers updated and informed about any issues and about the way in which we are solving them. This is our first time launching a Kickstarter campaign, but we will utilize all possible means of effort to offer the best customer services. You can support us with confidence.
